main_definition: Something that is not genuine or real, often created to deceive.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Intentionally imitating something in order to deceive others.
meanings_and_examples.example: He was caught trying to pass off a fake Rolex watch as the genuine article.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Not what it appears or seems to be; counterfeit or fraudulent.
meanings_and_examples.example: The online marketplace is full of fake designer handbags sold at low prices.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Lacking in authenticity or originality, often created for superficial purposes.
meanings_and_examples.example: She only wore fake jewelry to the party because it looked more expensive than it was worth.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An act of pretending; pretense or deception.
meanings_and_examples.example: The magician's trick involved him pulling a rabbit out of an empty hat, which fooled everyone in the audience.
